general_advisory: Harvested paddy should be threshed in the clean floor. Spray pesticides during morning hours or evening hours to manage the pests. Keep a watch on the disease and pests attack on the crops. Maintain plant population by emphasizing row to row and plant to plant spacing.

advisory: Complete the harvesting of paddy.
Harvested paddy to be kept at safe places.
The moisture should be reduced to 12 - 14%.
Remove the false smut affected paddy panicles during harvesting and threshing process.
Carefully thresh the paddy. Remember to thresh the paddy in clean and disinfectant threshing floor.
If soil moisture is low, provide irrigation to the soil.
Alternaria leaf blight in chickpea can be reduced by spraying Mancozeb @ 2.5 g/lt.
Weeding from the field should be done regularly.
The wilted plants should be uprooted and disposed away from the field.
Maintain the spacing of 30 cm row to row and 10 cm plant to plant in the field.
After sowing, provide irrigation to the crops for better and early germination.
Remove weeds from the field.
Spray Imidachloprid 17.8 SL @ 1 ml/lt to manage aphids and whitefly infestation.
Complete the sowing of linseed in line sowing.
One irrigation is required after the sowing.
Make sure to maintain the spacing and plant population.
Remove any weeds from the root zone.
Cauliflower borer can be managed by manually destroying the borers.
In case of heavy infestation spray Cartap hydrochloride @ 6 g/15 lts.
Fruit and shoot borer infestation can be reduced by spraying Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 4g/10 lt.
Harvest the fruits and keep them at safe places.
Remove the leaf blight affected leaves and damaged twigs.
Harvest the matured fruit and keep them at safe places.
If banana bunch is broken and fruits are not matured yet, spray ethrel/ethylene for rapid ripening.
For managing aphids, spray Imidachloprid @ 1 ml/lt.
Papaya ring spot virus can be managed by spraying Malathion or Imidachloprid @ 1ml/lt.
